NAME: Chinatown Heritage Centre
Opening Hours: Daily, 9am – 8pm,Last entry at 7pm.*Chinatown Heritage Centre will be closed for renovation from 1 October 2014 till end-2015.
Description1: Experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture at the Chinatown Heritage Centre.
Description2: At the Chinatown Heritage Centre, experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture.
Image Text: Learn more about local Chinese culture at the Singapore Chinatown Heritage Centre.

NAME: Thian Hock Keng Temple
Description1: Beautifully restored, Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.
Description2: Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.
Image Text: The Thian Hock Keng Temple in Singapore is dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.

NAME: Eurasian Heritage Centre
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 6pm, Closed on Monday
Description1: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
Description2: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
Image Text: Discover the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.

NAME: Shophouses
Description1: With many beautifully preserved examples on hand today, the shophouses in Singapore are prime examples of timeless architectural appeal.
Description2: Few buildings epitomise our culture as fully as the shophouse, with its surprisingly harmonious mix of diverse design elements.
Image Text: The varying styles of Singapore's shophouses are a showcase of our evolving architecture.

NAME: Pinnacle@Duxton
Description1: The soaring lines and stunning views of majestic residential estate Pinnacle at Duxton will make you forget your fear of heights. Almost.
Description2: With its lofty towers and dizzying sky gardens, the Pinnacle at Duxton takes residential living to soaring new heights.
Image Text: The Pinnacle@Duxton's architecture is a refreshing change in a sea of concrete blocks.

NAME: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
Description1: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque will captivate you with its intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences.
Description2: With its tilting European-style minaret and Chinese tiling, the Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the most unique mosques in Singapore.
Image Text: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque in Singapore features an intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences.

NAME: Haw Par Villa
Description1: Embark on an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology at the Haw Par Villa theme park.
Description2: A visit to the Haw Par Villa theme park is an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology.

NAME: NUS Baba House
Opening Hours: Visits are by appointment only.Visitors must sign up in advance for heritage tours which fall on:Monday, 2pm – 3pm,Tuesday, 6.30pm – 7.30pm,Thursday, 10am – 11am,Saturday, 11am – 12pm
Description1: This heritage house lends rich insight into Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.
Description2: NUS Baba House is a heritage house that gives a rich look at Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.
Image Text: Beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts make the NUS Baba House a must-visit.

NAME: Hong San See Temple Singapore
Description1: Restored by expert craftsmen from China, the Hong San See temple has been brought back to its full glory.
Description2: Dancing dragons and prancing phoenixes are just some of the visual delights to catch at the exquisitely restored Hong San See temple.

NAME: Capitol Building Singapore
Description1: The queen of Singapore cinemas will soon reclaim her crown as the premier entertainment hub when Capitol Building reopens next year.
Description2: Now undergoing massive restoration works, Capitol Building will emerge as Singapore’s premier entertainment hub next year.
Image Text: The Capitol Building's distinctive facade adds a touch of grandeur to the cityscape.

NAME: Esplanade Theatre
Description1: This boldly designed performing arts centre has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.
Description2: The Esplanade is boldly designed performing arts centre that has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.
Image Text: Catch a world-class opera or pop concert at Singapore’s premier performing arts centre.

NAME: Gardens by the Bay
Description1: The lush and beautiful Gardens by the Bay is dominated by the sleekly sculptured biodomes – marvels of architecture, design and engineering.
Description2: Biodomes, baobabs and the blossoming bounty of every conceivable plant will bowl you over at Gardens by the Bay.
Image Text: Gardens by the Bay seamlessly blends sleek design, cutting-edge technology and fun.

NAME: The Interlace
Description1: There’s more than meets the eye in The Interlace’s artful arrangement of residential blocks.
Description2: Few buildings demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking as well as The Interlace, an intriguingly designed residential complex.

NAME: PARKROYAL on Pickering
Description1: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.
Description2: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.
Image Text: Pamper yourself and save the world at the same time at PARKROYAL on Pickering.

NAME: Lasalle College of the Arts
Opening Hours: Administration Office, Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm. Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours
Description1: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
Description2: Lasalle College of the Arts evokes awe with its bold, graphic lines and stunning reinterpretation of nature.
Image Text: Lasalle College of the Arts pushes the boundaries of creativity in architecture

NAME: Old Supreme Court Singapore
Description1: From dispensing justice to displaying art, the Old Supreme Court undergoes an overhaul for its new role as the National Gallery Singapore.
Description2: Due to reopen as the National Gallery Singapore, the Old Supreme Court is in itself a masterpiece of classical art.
Image Text: The Old Supreme Court lends a stately presence to the heart of Singapore city.

NAME: SIT Flats Singapore
Street: Seng Poh Road and Tiong Bahru Road
Description1: Take a walk back in time through the Art Deco architecture in the heritage neighbourhood of Tiong Bahru.
Description2: The Art Deco elegance of the flats in Tiong Bahru speak of the richness of a vanished world.
Image Text: The charm of Tiong Bahru comes to life through its Art Deco architecture.

NAME: Lau Pa Sat Singapore
Description1: The grande dame of markets in Singapore, Lau Pa Sat blends history, striking architecture and scrumptious local food into one heady experience.
Description2: The historic market Lau Pa Sat offers a winning combination of graceful colonial architecture, a longstanding heritage and delicious food.
Image Text: Lau Pa Sat blends graceful colonial architecture, heritage and delicious food.

NAME: Malay Heritage Centre
Opening Hours: Malay Heritage Centre Museum, Tuesday to Sunday, 10am – 6pm, Closed on Monday, Malay Heritage Centre Compound, Tuesday to Sunday, 8am – 8pm, Friday and Saturday, 8am – 10pm, Closed on Monday
Description1: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
Description2: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
Image Text: Delve into the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.

NAME: Peranakan Museum Singapore
Description1: Get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and history at this top-notch museum, filled with fine artefacts and fun exhibits.
Description2: At the Peranakan Museum, get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and its eclectic culture and history with fun and interactive exhibits.
Image Text: Many communities, one nation. Find out more about our people, such as the ubiquitous Peranakans.

NAME: Raffles Singapore
Description1: Hark back to a golden age of elegant refinement and gracious living at Raffles Singapore, where the past reawakens to glorious life.
Description2: Sip a Singapore Sling beneath the whirling fans at the Long Bar, and let the tranquil charms of Raffles Singapore bring you back into another era.
Image Text: The iconic Raffles Hotel has been home to both tall tales and famous folks.

NAME: Gillman Barracks – YourSingapore
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Saturday, 11am - 7pm, Sunday, 11am - 6pm , Galleries closed on Monday and public holidays.
Description1: A former British military camp is now Asia's new Destination for Contemporary Art.
Description2: Gillman Barracks Singapore is Asia’s vibrant new destination for the creation, exhibition and discussion of contemporary art.

NAME: National Museum of Singapore
Opening Hours: Singapore History Gallery Daily, 10am – 6pm,Last admission at 5.30pm.Singapore Living Galleries Daily, 10am – 8pm Free admission from 6pm –8pm , Last admission at 7.30pm
Description1: Singapore’s oldest museum is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.
Description2: The National Museum of Singapore is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.
Image Text: The National Museum of Singapore building is also an architectural icon that is stunning to behold.

NAME: The Japanese Cemetery Park
Description1: Located in Hougang, this is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia and the burial ground of Singapore’s early Japanese community.
Description2: The Japanese Cemetery Park is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia, containing nearly 1,000 graves of Singapore’s early Japanese community.
Image Text: The Japanese Cemetery Park holds the ashes of thousands of Japanese soldiers, marines and airmen killed during World War II.

NAME: Dalhousie Obelisk
Description1: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.
Description2: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.
Image Text: The Dalhousie Obelisk is a historically significant piece of Singapore architecture.

NAME: Raffles Statue – Sir Stamford Raffles Landing Site
Description1: The sculpture depicts Sir Stamford Raffles, founder of modern Singapore. Two statues exist, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.
Description2: Raffles Statue depicts the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles. Two statues exist today, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.

NAME: Singapore Philatelic Museum
Description1: The Singapore Philatelic Museum offers windows into Singapore and the world through stamps.
Description2: The Philatelic Museum offers visitors postage stamp-sized windows into Singapore and the rest of the world.
Image Text: Take a colourful trip back in time at this Singapore museum dedicated to postage stamps and related materials.

NAME: Lim Bo Seng Memorial
Description1: This gazetted national monument at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.
Description2: The gazetted Lim Bo Seng Memorial at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.
Image Text: The Lim Bo Seng Memorial commemorates one of Singapore's heroes from World War II.

NAME: Kranji War Memorial Landmark
Description1: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.
Description2: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.
Image Text: The serene Kranji War Memorial, Singapore is a hillside cemetery set in a quiet neighbourhood.

NAME: Indian National Army (INA) Monument
Description1: This marker at Esplanade Park was one of the eleven World War II markers erected in 1995 to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.
Description2: The Indian National Army (INA) Monument at Esplanade Park is a memorial that was built in 1995 to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.
Image Text: The Indian National Army Monument tells an intriguing story of Singapore's past.

NAME: Reflections at Bukit Chandu
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 5.30pm,Closed on Monday (except on public holidays)
Description1: This heritage centre relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.
Description2: Reflections at Bukit Chandu relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.
Image Text: Reflections at Bukit Chandu is housed in a lovingly restored colonial bungalow.

NAME: The Cenotaph
Description1: This war memorial in Esplanade Park honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.
Description2: The Cenotaph in Singapore is a war memorial in Esplanade Park that honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.
Image Text: Surrounded by lush green, The Cenotaph sits at a quiet spot amid the city buzz.

NAME: The Civilian War Memorial park
Street: Bras Basah Road & Beach Road intersection
Description1: Situated at the War Memorial Park in Beach Road, this memorial commemorates civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation in Singapore.
Description2: The Civilian War Memorial and park in Beach Road commemorates Singapore’s civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation during World War II.

NAME: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple
Description1: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore’s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India.
Description2: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore’s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India.
Image Text: The Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is a distinctive landmark in the heart of Little India.

NAME: Maghain Aboth Synagogue
Opening Hours: Visits are available only by appointment. For more information, email jewishwb@singnet.com.sg or call +65 6337 2189 (ext. 103)
Description1: The Maghain Aboth Synagogue is a gem in more ways than one, providing both a snapshot of history and a glimpse into a rich culture.
Description2: The simple exterior of the Maghain Aboth Synagogue gives no indication of its richly elegant interiors.

NAME: Sultan Mosque (Masjid Sultan) Singapore
Description1: Also known as Masjid Sultan, the impressive Sultan Mosque in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore’s Muslim community.
Description2: The impressive Sultan Mosque (also known as Masjid Sultan) in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore’s Muslim community.

NAME: Sri Mariamman Temple
Description1: Located in Chinatown, the Sri Mariamman Temple dates back to 1827 and is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore.
Description2: Sri Mariamman Temple, located in Chinatown, is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore.
Image Text: Sri Mariamman Temple's ornate and elaborate detailing makes it a wonder to behold.

NAME: Armenian Church
Description1: The oldest Christian church in Singapore is an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century.
Description2: The Armenian Church is the oldest Christian church in Singapore and an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century.
Image Text: The Armenian Church in Singapore is a 19th-century architectural masterpiece.

NAME: CHIJMES Singapore
Opening Hours: Daily, 24 hours,Opening hours of businesses in CHIJMES may vary.
Description1: Whether functioning as a school or a lifestyle and entertainment complex, it appears the beauty of CHIJMES is only equalled by its versatility.
Description2: Who would have thought a former school would make such a graceful transition? As a lifestyle and entertainment complex, CHIJMES soars high above the rest.
Image Text: The charm of CHIJMES, Singapore harks back to a bygone, gracious age.

NAME: St Andrew’s Cathedral
Description1: Singapore's largest cathedral is a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage.
Description2: St Andrew's Cathedral is Singapore's largest cathedral and a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage.
Image Text: Singapore's largest cathedral is worth a visit for its architectural beauty.

NAME: ArtScience Museum Singapore
Description1: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at this premier exhibition space.
Description2: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at the ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands.
Image Text: The ArtScience Museum in Singapore hosts a variety of international touring exhibitions.

NAME: Old Ford Factory Singapore Museum
Description1: The Old Ford Factory holds an archive of memories about Singapore's wartime occupation by the Japanese.
Description2: The Old Ford Factory is a repository of memories about the hardships endured during the Japanese Occupation of Singapore.
Image Text: The site of the first Ford plant in Southeast Asia, the Old Ford Factory in Singapore is a journey to the past.

NAME: Singapore Coins and Notes Museum & Museum Singapore
Description1: The rare collection of currencies on display here tells Singapore’s story through the money it has used over the years.
Description2: The Singapore Coins and Notes Museum tells the story of Singapore through the currencies it has used over the years.
Image Text: Explore the city of Singapore through its coins and notes over the years at the Singapore Coins and Notes Museum.

NAME: Singapore City Gallery
Description1: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.
Description2: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.

NAME: Changi Museum Singapore
Description1: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.
Description2: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.
Image Text: Explore our wartime past by learning about the Fall of Singapore and the infamous Changi Prison.

NAME: MINT Museum of Toys Singapore & Toy Museum
Description1: This toy museum will delight both adults and kids with the vast collection of vintage toys and memorabilia from around the world.
Description2: Singapore's MINT Museum of Toys' vast collection of vintage toys will delight both kids and adults.
Image Text: More than 50,000 vintage toys from as many as 40 countries are on display at this Singapore toy museum.

NAME: Chinese Heritage Centre
Opening Hours: Monday to Friday, 9.30am – 5pm,Saturday and Sunday, 10am –5pm, Closed on public holidays
Description1: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.
Description2: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.
Image Text: Explore questions on ethnic identity such as what it means to be a Chinese.

NAME: Kampong Glam & Malay Culture
Description1: Discover Kampong Glam's rich history, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in this vibrant neighbourhood.
Description2: Discover the heart of Singapore’s Malay community, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in vibrant Kampong Glam.
Image Text: Delve into Malay culture at the heart of its community, Kampong Glam Singapore.

NAME: Contemporary Arts Center
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm – 7pm Friday, 12pm – 9pm , Closed on Monday. Open on public holiday.
Description1: This university arts research centre explores contemporary art through exhibitions, public programmes, residencies and research programmes.
Description2: The Contemporary Arts Center at the Nanyang Technological University uses a variety of medium to explore contemporary art.
Image Text: The Contemporary Arts Center hosts exhibitions, live performances, film screenings and talks by visiting artists and curators.

NAME: The Substation
Opening Hours: The Substation Box Office ,Monday to Friday, 12pm - 2pm and 5pm - 8pm.Saturday and Sunday, open an hour prior to weekend showtimes. Closed on public holidays.The Substation Gallery Daily, 12pm – 9pm Closed on public holidays
Description1: This experimental arts centre gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts.
Description2: The Substation is an experimental arts centre that gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts.

NAME: Red Dot Design Museum
Opening Hours: Monday - Friday, 11am – 6 pm, Saturday and Sunday, 11am – 8 pm
Description1: This museum holds more than 1,000 award-winning products, communications and concepts that will delight design fans.
Description2: The Red Dot Design Museum holds more than 1,000 products and items that are winners for their good design.
Image Text: Award-winning exhibits at the Red Dot Design Museum in Singapore are sure to delight design fans.

NAME: Singapore Art Museum
Description1: Singapore Art Museum is Singapore’s contemporary art museum, focused on Southeast Asian contemporary art.
Description2: The Singapore Art Museum houses the world’s largest public collection of contemporary Southeast Asian artworks.
Image Text: Get to know the works of contemporary artists around Southeast Asia at the Singapore Art Museum.

NAME: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay
Description1: Catch a non-stop line-up of world-class performances at Singapore’s premier arts centre.
Description2: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay is the country’s premier arts centre as well as an iconic landmark on the city’s skyline.
Image Text: Get your dose of creativity at Esplanade Theatres on the Bay, Singapore's premier arts centre.
Image By: Mori Hidetaka, Courtesy of Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay
INC_CRC: Daily, 12pm – 8.30pm, The Esplanade Box Office will open 1 hour prior to show commencement for shows before 12 noon and will remain open up to half an hour after show commencement for shows starting after 8.30pm.

NAME: National Design Centre
Description1: The National Design Centre is the nexus for all things design. It hosts design exhibitions, events and programmes that will quicken the pulse of design lovers.
Description2: The National Design Centre is a design lover’s dream destination.
Image Text: Explore the wonderful world of design at the National Design Centre, Singapore.

NAME: Victoria Theatre Singapore
Description1: After a four-year refurbishment, the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has since reopened, with its first official concert held there in August 2014.
Description2: The historic Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has been transformed to meet the needs of a modern audience.
Image Text: Catch world-class performances at stunning venues, like The Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall.

NAME: NUS University Museum
Street: 50 Kent Ridge Crescent, National University of Singapore
Description1: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at this museum on the campus of the National University of Singapore.
Description2: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at NUS Museum at Singapore’s leading university.
Image Text: The NUS Museum in Singapore houses more than 8,000 exhibits that take you back to the past.

NAME: Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 10am – 5pm, Closed on Monday
Description1: This revamped museum is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.
Description2: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.
Image Text: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall pays tribute to the revolutionary leader.

NAME: Asian Civilisations Museum & Singapore Museum
Description1: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum tells the stories of Asian civilisations through its permanent collections.
Description2: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum is a microcosm of Asian civilisations spread over 11 galleries.
Image Text: The Asian Civilizations Museum, Singapore is a historic building that tells the story of Asian civilisation.

NAME: Singapore Botanic Gardens
Opening Hours: Singapore Botanic Gardens Daily, 5am - 12am National Orchid Garden Daily, 8.30am - 7pm(last ticket sales at 6pm)Jacob Ballas Children's Garden Tuesday to Sunday, 8am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)Closed every Monday (except when it falls on a designated public holiday)SBG Heritage MuseumDaily*, 9am - 6pm*Closed every last Monday of the month (except when it falls on a designated public holiday, it will be closed the following day)
Description1: Singapore’s oldest garden is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.
Description2: Singapore’s Botanic Gardens is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.

NAME: Singapore Zoo
Description1: Singapore’s zoo is a beautiful, award-winning wildlife park, where animals can roam freely in their natural habitats.
Description2: Catch animals in their natural habitats at the award-winning Singapore Zoo.
Image Text: The award-winning Singapore Zoo lets you see your favourite animals in all their natural wonder.

NAME: River Safari Singapore
Description1: At the River Safari Singapore, meet manatees and monkeys, piranhas and pandas, as they congregate in and around the park’s waters.
Description2: The River Safari Singapore is a fascinating new wildlife park that recreates life in and around the world’s rivers.
Image Text: Meet manatees, monkeys and more as you ride the world's rivers at River Safari, Singapore.

NAME: Cable Car Singapore & Mount Faber
Description1: Getting to this hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car  is half the fun.
Description2: Getting to the hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car is half the fun.
Image Text: Spend a unique evening overlooking spectacular views on a cable car in Singapore's Mount Faber.

NAME: Night Safari
Opening Hours: Daily, 7.30pm - 12am .Last ticket sale at 11.15pm.F and B and retail outlets open from 5.30pm
Description1: Instead of going to a club, pop into another popular nightspot, the Night Safari, and mingle with a different crowd of animals at this special zoo.
Description2: Head to the Night Safari for an after dark visit to the weird and wonderful creatures of the night.
Image Text: Enter a world of nocturnal creatures at the Night Safari, Singapore.

NAME: Pulau Ubin & Singapore Islands
Description1: Gravel roads, lush forests and abundant wildlife – Pulau Ubin is a living showcase of what Singapore was like in the 1960s.
Description2: Hop on a bumboat to the island of Pulau Ubin if you want a taste of nature and rustic village life, away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore.

NAME: Little India Singapore
Description1: Little India is a buzzing historic area that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community from vibrant culture to incredible shopping.
Description2: Little India is a buzzing historic district that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community, from vibrant culture to ethnic-inspired shopping.
Image Text: Immerse yourself in the rich culture of Little India, Singapore.

NAME: Orchard Road
Description1: Orchard Road, Asia’s most famous shopping street, is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.
Description2: Don’t miss a trip to Orchard Road. Asia’s most famous shopping street is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.
Image Text: Orchard Road, Singapore is nothing short of a shopper's paradise.

NAME: MacRitchie Singapore & Singapore Nature Reserve
Description1: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir is a playground of nature for those who love the outdoors.
Description2: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir caters to fitness fanatics, water sports enthusiasts and nature lovers.
Image Text: MacRitchie Reservoir is nature’s playground for those who love the great outdoors.

NAME: Civic District
Description1: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage started.
Description2: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage starts.
Image Text: Immerse yourself in a day of history and culture at the Civic District, Singapore.

NAME: HarbourFront
Description1: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a regional ferry or simply want to eat, shop or relax.
Description2: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a ferry to the outlying islands or simply want to eat, shop or relax.
Image Text: HarbourFront, Singapore is your exciting gateway to entertainment and Singapore's outlying islands.

NAME: Bras Basah.Bugis
Description1: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the arts and heritage district in Singapore's civic centre, and home to museums and monuments.
Description2: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the vibrant arts and cultural district in the heart of Singapore's civic centre, and home to top museums and monuments.
Image Text: There’s nowhere else quite like shopping at Bugis.

NAME: SAM at 8Q & Singapore Art Museum
Description1: An extension of the Singapore Art Museum, SAM at 8Q features contemporary art exhibitions and is home to a Moving Image Gallery, where film screenings are held.
Description2: SAM at 8Q at the Singapore Art Museum showcases the works of Singapore contemporary artists.
Image Text: SAM at 8Q is the funkier sister of the Singapore Art Museum.

NAME: Jamae Mosque (Masjid Chulia) Singapore
Description1: Also known as Masjid Chulia, Jamae Mosque is one of Singapore’s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s.
Description2: Jamae Mosque (or Masjid Chulia) is one of Singapore’s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s.
Image Text: The Jamae Mosque in Singapore is one of the oldest mosques in Singapore.

NAME: Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore
Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm - 7pm, Closed on Monday and public holidays
Street: LASALLE College of the Arts, 1 McNally Street
Description1: This experimental art space housed in a tertiary arts college will help you deepen your understanding of contemporary art.
Description2: Housed in a tertiary arts college, the Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore will help you deepen your appreciation for experimental artworks.
Image Text: Be inspired by the architecture and creativity at the Institute of Contemporary Arts, Singapore.

NAME: Singapore Flyer
Description1: This giant observation wheel offers 360-degree city views, a panorama that stretches to parts of Malaysia and Indonesia on a clear day.
Description2: The Singapore Flyer not only offers you stunning views of the city, but is one of the city’s most recognisable architectural icons.
Image Text: Marvel at spectacular panoramas of the city skyline from the Singapore Flyer.

NAME: Marina Bay Sands®
Opening Hours: SkyPark<sup® Operating Hours - Monday to Thursday, 9:30am – 10pm, Friday to Sunday, 9:30am – 11pm, Shoppes Daily, 10am – 10pm (hours vary by store)
Description1: A feat of engineering, an architectural statement and a sheer aesthetic triumph, Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> has upped the ante for buildings in Singapore.
Description2: Superlatives naturally spring to mind when beholding Marina Bay Sands®. Its bold, swooping curves, steep slopes, and soaring spaces defy gravity and evoke awe.
Image Text: The breathtaking Marina Bay Sands is a sheer modern architectural triumph.

NAME: Marina Barrage
Opening Hours: Marina Barrage - All day  Information Counter Daily, 9am – 9pm
Description1: This innovative facility not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun.
Description2: The Marina Barrage not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun.
Image Text: More than just an ordinary dam, the Marina Barrage is an ideal recreational space.

NAME: Henderson Waves Bridge
Description1: Lush jungle is broken up with a seriously creative twist in the fantastic form of the Henderson Waves bridge.
Description2: With the Henderson Waves bridge, form meets function to stunning effect.
Image Text: Explore some of the city’s best parks and trails, such as the Southern Ridges Walk.

NAME: Labrador Nature Reserve
Description1: With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve.
Description2: With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve.
Image Text: Labrador Nature Reserve in Singapore is a beautiful park that is rich with biodiversity.

NAME: Marina Bay Singapore
Description1: Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish, from trendy dining destinations to exciting leisure spots.
Description2: Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish in Singapore, from trendy dining destinations to fun leisure spots.
Image Text: Marina Bay Sands® is an integrated resort with experiences like no other.

NAME: Marina Bay Sands
Opening Hours: Opening hours varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
Description1: This iconic integrated resort boasts luxury accommodations, upscale shopping and an infinity pool with unparalleled views of the city.
Description2: Marina Bay Sands® boasts luxury accommodations, upscale shopping and an infinity pool with unparalleled views of the city.

NAME: Chek Jawa
Description1: A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, this natural wonder is one of Singapore’s richest eco-systems.
Description2: A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, the natural wonder of Chek Jawa is one of Singapore’s richest eco-systems.
Image Text: Bird lovers can spot rare species from a 21-metre tall viewing tower at Chek Jawa.

NAME: Merlion Park
Description1: Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the waterfront Merlion Park.
Description2: Merlion Park houses a Singapore icon that is half-fish and half-lion, and famous throughout the world.
Image Text: Come and see the Singapore icon that is half-fish and half-lion at the Merlion Park.

NAME: Marina Bay Sands® SkyPark
Description1: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.
Description2: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.
Image Text: Take in stunning views from an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds at the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark.

NAME: Resorts World Sentosa
Opening Hours: Opening hours differ for the various attractions.
Description1: Experience endless excitement at Resorts World Sentosa with a variety of attractions and entertainment hot spots.
Description2: Whether it’s themes parks, world-class performances or celebrity restaurants, you’ll never run out of things to do at Resorts World™ Sentosa.
Image Text: From world-class theme parks to celebrity restaurants, Resorts World Sentosa has it all.

NAME: Singapore Garden & Singapore Park
Street: Henderson Road, Mount Faber Park, Telok Blangah Hill Park
Description1: This 10-km stretch of connecting trails lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat.
Description2: The Southern Ridges is a 10-km stretch of connecting trails which lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat.
Image Text: From world-class theme parks to celebrity restaurants, Resorts World Sentosa has it all.

NAME: Sungei Buloh
Description1: This ecological wonder will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.
Description2: The ecological wonder of Sungei Buloh will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.
Image Text: Get up close with a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat at this Singapore Garden.

NAME: S.E.A. Aquarium
Opening Hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
Description1: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and discover more than 100,000 marine animals.
Description2: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and take a look into the planet’s largest window to the ocean.
Image Text: Explore a world rich with animal and plant life at the Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve.

NAME: Singapore River
Description1: Get to know historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. After all, this is where it all began.
Description2: Get to know the historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. This, after all, is where it all began.
Image Text: Take a stroll along the Singapore River and see how the city came to be.

NAME: Joo Chiat/Katong
Description1: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in this charming corner of eastern Singapore.
Description2: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in Joo Chiat/Katong, a charming corner of eastern Singapore.
Image Text: Spend a day exploring heritage shophouses and quaint stores at Joo Chiat/Katong.

NAME: Sentosa Island
Description1: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort.
Description2: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination, with more than 500 hectares filled with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa.
Image Text: Get ready for laughs, thrills and loads of fun in the sun at Sentosa Island.

NAME: Chinatown Singapore
Description1: Singapore’s historic Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and markets as well as cool stores and cafes.
Description2: Singapore’s legendary Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and night markets as well as cool stores and cafes.
Image Text: Chinatown, Singapore is a bustling mix of old-world charm and modern delights.

NAME: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum
Description1: This Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown gets its name from what the Buddhists regard as the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.
Description2: The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum is a Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown that gets its name from the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.

NAME: National Gallery Singapore
Opening Hours: Effective from 24 November 2015, Sunday to Thursday and  public holidays,10am - 7pm ,Friday to Saturday and  eve of public holidays, 10am - 10pm
Description1: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.
Description2: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.

NAME: Universal Studios Singapore™ Theme Park
Opening Hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
Description1: Step into the glamorous world of movies at this world-class theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa™.
Description2: Universal Studios Singapore™ at Resorts World™ Sentosa is a movie-themed entertainment park that the whole family can enjoy.
Image Text: Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie theme park offers a dizzying selection of entertainment offerings.

NAME: Singapore Science Centre
Opening Hours: Science Centre Singapore Daily, 10am – 6pm(last admission: 5.15pm) .Omni Theatre Daily, 12pm – 6pm (last show: 6pm) . Snow City Daily, 10am – 6pm (last admission: 5pm) School and public holidays, 10am – 7pm (last admission: 6pm)
Description1: This enlightening attraction holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in Singapore.
Description2: Singapore Science Centre holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in the country.
Image Text: Adults and kids of all ages who are not even science buffs will have fun at the Singapore Science Centre.

NAME: Fuk Tak Chi Museum & Places of Interest
Description1: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.
Description2: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.
Image Text: Marvel at the Fuk Tak Chi Museum's carefully restored architecture in the heart of Chinatown.

NAME: Katong Antique House Singapore
Description1: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.
Description2: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.
Image Text: Marvel at antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection at the Katong Antique House.

NAME: Chinese Garden Singapore
Description1: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.
Description2: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.
Image Text: Step back in time to ancient China at the beautiful Chinese Garden, Singapore.

NAME: East Coast Park Singapore
Street: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road
Description1: With so many attractions packed into this 15-km stretch of beaches, you’ll never run out of things to do.
Description2: With so many attractions packed into the 15-km stretch of beaches at East Coast Park, you’ll never run out of things to do.
Image Text: Whether you prefer water sports, rollerblading or cycling, find a myriad of things to do at East Coast Park, Singapore.

NAME: Fort Canning Park
Street: Bounded by Hill Street, Canning Rise, Clemenceau Avenue and River Valley Road
Description1: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic landmark on a hill is full of surprises.
Description2: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic Fort Canning Park has something for everyone.
Image Text: Take a stroll back in time at Fort Canning Park, Singapore - a landmark full of history.

NAME: Kusu Island
Description1: If you’re looking for local heritage off the beaten track with a good dash of nature, Kusu Island hits the spot.
Description2: Kusu Island lies to the south of Singapore, and has a wonderful mix of local heritage and beach activities.

NAME: Jurong Bird Park
Description1: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.
Description2: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.
Image Text: Enjoy close encounters with some of our prettiest and rarest feathered friends at the Jurong Bird Park.

NAME: HortPark
Description1: Lose yourself in this dreamscape of stunning gardens that will make you forget the bustle of city.
Description2: HortPark is a gorgeous collection of stunning gardens and plants that will make you  forget about the bustle of city.
Image Text: Escape the buzz of the city at HortPark, Singapore.

NAME: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore
Description1: Make a big splash at this aquatic adventure park at Resorts World™ Sentosa.
Description2: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore at Resorts World™ Sentosa promises a day of wet and wild fun in the sun.
Image Text: Adventure Cove Waterpark™, Singapore is the perfect place to have fun with loved ones.
